1.title: 201A-The Insider
1.plot: George loves and appreciates all the animals in the jungle... except for Slippy, the tape-worm living inside his stomach. But everything changes when the table are turned and George finds himself living inside a giant snake!

2.title: 201B-Clockwork George
2.plot: George tests Ape's patience one time too many and George's mentor turns to some extreme methods to whip him into shape. Specifically, by putting bitey-bitey ants down his loincloth. But when Ape goes one bite too far, he has to journey into the depths of George's psyche to get his friend back.

3.title: 202A-Bringing Silverback
3.plot: Ape has never been a great ape - especially compared to his show-off big brother Ted. So when the family Silverback is up for grabs, Ape puts everything on the line to prove that he's as ape as any gorilla in the jungle.

4.title: 202B-Of Botflies and Men
4.plot: Olaf has been in George's for as long as he can remember. It's like any other deep, meaningful friendship... except for the tiny detail that Olaf is a botfly living in George's skin. When Olaf gets eaten, George learns that he can't run from his feelings - and that eagles are jerks.

5.title: 203A-True Bromance
5.plot: When Ape and George get lost on the River of Time, they run into their younger selves. Eager not to disappoint Young George and Young Ape, our heroes live out their childhood dreams. In the process, George and Ape learn a lot about their friendship... and that their childhood dreams were really dumb.

6.title: 203B-George X 4
6.plot: As King of the Jungle, George is an important role model to all the jungle animals. So when he starts driving a sweet SUV, his kingdom quickly turns into one long traffic jam as everyone gets in on the act!

7.title: 204A-Strong as He Can Tree
7.plot: George swings into trees. Like, a lot of them. So when Ape and Magnolia set out to fix this problem, they discover that George and trees were made to be together, and that slamming into them is actually the source of his strength...

8.title: 204B-George's Song
8.plot: George has a secret. No, it's not that! It's actually his beautiful singing voice. Ridiculed for it, George has kept it hidden for years - until the only way to save his friends is to let go of the past and use his talent... and sing George's song.

9.title: 205A-Queen of the Desert
9.plot: Negotiations between the Jungle and Desert Kingdoms have always been delicate. So delicate that the thick-headed George finds himself benched by the Ape Council. Desperate to prove himself, George challenges his replacement, a log, to a test of kingly skills. It's just too bad for George that the log turns out to be pretty slick...

10.title: 205B-Kings and Little Ones
10.plot: When George accidentally ends up in the Jungle King Afterlife (read: dies), he meets the jungle kings of yesteryear... and immediately starts to feel inadequate. Returning to life, George sets out to prove that he's just as impressive as any of his ancestors!

11.title: 206A-Renaissance Ape
11.plot: Ape loves mentoring George, but sometimes he just feels... intellectually unfulfilled. Desperate to flex his grey matter, Ape forms a secret friendship with Doctor Chicago and the two become best brain buddies... but can this nerd-fling last?

12.title: 206B-My Georging Jacket
12.plot: It looks like George's reign as king is over when Tiger and Weevil paralyse him with a poisonous No-Licky Frog. But George proves that he's relentless, and fashionable, when he discovers that he can still make a difference... as clothing!

13.title: 207A-Bananium Deficiency
13.plot: George and Magnolia go bananas for bananas. They are crazy for the yellow and it's not like they're going to run out, right? They run out.

14.title: 207B-I Gotta Beave Me
14.plot: The discovery of beavers in the jungle somehow sends George on a soul-searching quest to find out what it means to be human. Now George really doesn't find out much, but man does he put some evil beavers in their place!

15.title: 208A-Steve of the Jungle
15.plot: When George is sidelined by a jungle illness, the Ape Council calls in Steve to pinch-hit. George is horrified to learn that not only was Steve originally meant to be king, but that he's better than George in every way... except the one that really counts.

16.title: 208B-Guess What's Coming to Dinner
16.plot: George and his friends can't stand Ape's Jungle Jellies. So instead of being honest and telling him the truth - they are forced to deal with desserts come to life, enslavement and an alien invasion... but at least Ape isn't disappointed, right?

17.title: 209A-Nature's Call
17.plot: George and Ursula are like ying and yang. George saves the jungle animals, Ursula terrifies them. When Ursula is taken out of the equation, George discovers that there's such a thing as too much help as the jungle goes all soft. Can George restore balance to the force before the jungle turns into the world's largest petting zoo?

18.title: 209B-Much Ado About Stuffing
18.plot: George has always relied on muscle to get by. So when Doctor Chicago turns him into an adorable stuffed animal, George has to rely on his wits to save the day... yep, they're all doomed.

19.title: 210A-Sour Milk
19.plot: George and Ape discover the cure to all the jungle's problems in a jug of six month old milk! But George discovers that life in a perfect jungle isn't all it's cracked up to be...

20.title: 210B-Valley of the Magnolias
20.plot: Tired of being the bottom of the food chain, Magnolia has herself classified an endangered species. She's thrilled with life in the first-class section of the jungle, until George and Ape decide to teach her a lesson and have her placed in her own personal zoo...

21.title: 211A-Meet Meat
21.plot: George makes a shocking discovery: meat is made from animals! Driven by guilt, George conducts a seance to contact the spirits of lunches past... only to unleash a ghostly meat storm on the unsuspecting jungle.

22.title: 211B-Body Politics
22.plot: George has never been kind to his body. So when it gets wrecked one time too many it goes on strike, leaving George as just a head. George does eventually learn to take better care of his body, but not before Chicago gets his hands on it to wreak some jungle havoc!

23.title: 212A-Shadow of a Dolt
23.plot: It's Migration Season and George isn't above taking any shortcut to get out of his painful migration-managing duties. Even taking advantage of a George from an alternate dimension...

24.title: 212B-Lovecano
24.plot: When Ursula becomes linked to the volcano, her slightest temper tantrums turn into mega-eruptions! Lucky for our jungle heroes, George and Ape find a switch on her back that turns Ursula from feral to cuddly. Too bad the lovey-dovey Ursula is a gajillion times worse than the jungle-wrecking one...

25.title: 213A-For Science
25.plot: Magnolia sees Ursula as her ticket to academic fame and eagerly sells the feral jungle girl down the river. But when Magnolia sees what losing her freedom would mean to Ursula, she unleashes her own inner jungle girl...

26.title: 213B-Cute Is as Cute Does
26.plot: Doctor Chicago figures he's cracked this jungle conquering thing - he's going to unleash the mesmerizing power of cute! But when his cute formula accidentally transforms George into an adorable jungle-warping powerhouse, he knows only one way to save the situation - a cute-off! To the death!

27.title: 214A-Strange Daze
27.plot: Being king of the jungle is tough. George loves it, but sometimes he imagines what it would be like to walk a mile in his friend's shoes. Lucky for George a hypnotic plant is happy to help - unlucky for George it's also happy to eat his friends...

28.title: 214B-Lying Cloth
28.plot: Sometimes it's hard for George to admit his mistakes - good thing his new magical talking loincloth says he doesn't have to! George is living the high, guilt-free life... until he unleashes an underwear apocalypse, of course.

29.title: 215A-Mess of Kings
29.plot: George is a sentimental kind of king. So sentimental that he can't bear to part with a lifetime of garbage, even after it threatens the jungle with it's toxic smell. So when he tries, his garbage mound comes to life and gets really mad. It's like Frankenstein meets Free Willy. But with trash.

30.title: 215B-Rip Van George
30.plot: George has always wondered if he ever truly makes a difference... Well, what better way to find out than to be accidentally hurled into the future! George finds himself fighting an evil sloth empire for the freedom of the future jungle... ...and discovers that he does make a difference! Well, sort of.

31.title: 216A-Mama Chicago
31.plot: Doctor Chicago is the most dangerous threat the jungle has ever faced. That is, until his mother decides to pay her special little boy a visit. George and Chicago end up on the run from this mad woman together - George learning what having a mom really means, and Chicago learning that lasers hurt. A lot.

32.title: 216B-Reversum Day
32.plot: Bonkers Reversum day is the one day of the year where everything turns upside-down. Good becomes evil. Zebras chase tigers. Sloths go fast. But when George doesn't want to be bad, he finds himself battling hundreds of years of jungle tradition - and tradition fights dirty!

33.title: 217A-Swirl
33.plot: Ape has a secret. Actually it's more of a talking porcelain appliance. That's right, he has a hidden toilet and it's his sanctuary from the 'uncivilized' jungle. Too bad for Ape 'Swirl' has a will of his own and wants to explore the world! Is it really so wrong to keep a toilet in chains?

34.title: 217B-Jungle Junior Achievers
34.plot: When Cuspid finds out that George is starting his own jungle club for young animals, he sneaks out of Chicago's lair to join. When Chicago finds out he's furious... and then thrilled! Now Cuspid can take George and Ape down from the inside. Cuspid is torn - who does he choose: his creator or his new best friends? Is there a merit badge for moral dilemmas?

35.title: 218A-Wet Behind the Ears
35.plot: George discovers that there's a whole other world underwater. A world that needs a king to save it! But it turns out that George knows nothing about the life aquatic and he triggers a guppy-pocalypse!

36.title: 218B-Georgus Ex Machina
36.plot: After helping George and Ape out of a sticky situation with some helpful voice-over work, George deputizes the Narrator. At first it seems like having an omniscient sky voice at your side is just about the best thing ever... until that sky voice develops a jungle-sized ego and takes over the entire show...

37.title: 219A-Breaking Ape
37.plot: Ape has always followed the rules - but when he and George get thrown into jungle jail for a trivial violation, Ape discovers that some rules were meant to be broken. Oh, and he also learns that not only that crime DOES pay, but being a criminal is totally awesome! Warning: The views reflected by this episode do not necessarily reflect the opinions of its creators.

38.title: 219B-Sidekick Chicago
38.plot: When Cuspid gets a magical tree branch punched through his head, it gives him incredible mystical powers. Soon, he's top dog in the jungle, bending everyone to his will. His greatest enemy? No, not George, or tooth decay - it's a jealous Dr. Chicago!

39.title: 220A-The Ursula Solution
39.plot: Few things give Ursula as much joy as terrorizing the jungle - that is, until Tiger steals her feral-ness and turns the tables! Now Ursula gets a taste of her own medicine and y'know what - it doesn't taste good. Nope, not even a little!

40.title: 220B-George Lays an Egg
40.plot: One day George lays an egg... and that egg hatches into a mystical Hoopa-Hoopa bird. Now if George was a proper parent that bird wouldn't have fallen in with a bad crowd and turned evil... but he wasn't and it did. George learns an important lesson about responsibility. And he marries Dr. Chicago.

41.title: 221A-Excalibanana
41.plot: Ape has always played second fiddle to George - the jungle king always gets the spotlight and the applause! But when Ape discovers Excalibanana, the magical banana sword, he becomes quite the hero himself and takes top billing. Ape quickly learns that there's a lot more to being a hero than signing autographs and being famous...

42.title: 221B-The Flavour of Science
42.plot: Science is hard. At least Magnolia thinks it is... until she discovers Crunchbugs. Not only are they delicious, but they make her brain work a thousand times better! Soon she's fulfilling all her science dreams by winning a Nobel prize and becoming the most famous scientist ever! Actually, she nearly wipes out an entire species and transforms into a bug.

43.title: 222A-The George Who Would Be King
43.plot: After George saves a tribe of jerko-lemmings from certain doom, he finds himself worshipped as a jungle deity. Life gets pretty sweet, until the real jerko-lemming deity pays a visit to find out why he's not getting the love anymore...

44.title: 222B-The Peel of Fate
44.plot: Ever since he was a kid, Ape has dreamed of joining the Ape Council. But after he finally dons the fancy robes and the sacred peel, he finds himself longing for his old life with George. Sometimes success isn't everything it's cracked up to... especially when your co-workers are jerks.

45.title: 223A-Were George
45.plot: After watching Ursula, George thinks that running the jungle would be a whole lot easier if the animals were terrified of him. And what better way to become scary than to transform into a were-unicorn/badger/beaver/tiger/giraffe/zebra bush baby?

46.title: 223B-The Master of Macho
46.plot: Tiger is after the coveted Master of Macho title, and there's only one trophy that's going to win it for him - capturing the legendary Chupacabra. After the Chup captures Weevil, George and Tiger work together to track the beast... George learning that Chupacabras are really tricky, and Tiger that it's more macho to let something free.

47.title: 224A-Trial by Jungle
47.plot: Magnolia has never felt like she 'fit in' in the jungle - a feeling only made worse when she's abandoned by her friends in the wild. Does nobody like her!? But what seems like an epic ordeal of survival just turns out to be a really, really badly planned party thrown for her by her friends.

48.title: 224B-Slothpocalypto
48.plot: The jungle is in danger - a massive invasion is underway and George's friends are hypnotized. It's George versus an army of evil, invisible sloths! George needs to learn to think for himself - or condemn his world to an agonizingly slow doom...

49.title: 225A-Beave Me Alone
49.plot: George really doesn't trust beavers. So when trouble arises in the jungle, George is quick to point the finger at the tree-munching rodents. But while George is pre-occupied with pinning the blame on the beavers, the real culprits are free to complete their cute and super-fuzzy master plan...

50.title: 225B-Original Jungle Kings
50.plot: George and Ape are surprised when they pull their predecessors out from inside a giant snake. The last jungle king and his mentor are still alive - and man are they OLD. Taking up their old jobs, the senior citizens berate the jungle for getting all soft - time for some old school discipline! George and Ape take a stand, but totally get their butts handed to them. There's only one way to fight age and experience, and that's by getting old themselves!

51.title: 226A-The Last Treehugger
51.plot: It's George versus the jungle when he takes a stand for what he believes. Specifically, that a wizened old sloth is saving the world from an evil gravy - keeping the evil contained in tree form by continually hugging it for centuries. It's just too bad that the evil tree is marked for demolition by the Ape Council and nobody else believes him...

52.title: 226B-Heart of Gold
52.plot: When George encounters an evil so strong even he can't defeat it, he makes the ultimate sacrifice. He calls in the Steve and gives the villain his golden heart so that Steve will become good and save his jungle home... ...but George gets Steve's weasel heart in the bargain and turns evil himself! Now it's the jungle's turn to save its beloved king.

imdb.plot outline: The King of the Jungle is back and he's swinging in a whole new direction! This is the George you always wanted but were afraid to bring up at the dinner table for fear that Grandpa would write you out of his will and Mother would call in an exorcist to expel the demon comedy seed deep within your twisted soul. George is still a big-hearted, Jungle King who throws himself into his job like any teenage boy would - with boundless enthusiasm and reckless abandon. One minute he's defending the jungle from an air assault by a patrol of WWII flying squirrels, the next, he's moving all the animals into mole tunnels during the yearly jungle fumigation. George may not understand civilization but no one understands his jungle the way he does. Like, who knew that shaving stripes off zebras turns them invisible? George! And who knew that pink flamingos are the toughest mobsters and the best ballroom dancers in the jungle? George! Oh sure, crazy plans lead George and his pals into ridiculous situations and crazy detours that drive everyone in the animal kingdom bananas. But in the end, George always rises above the mayhem and saves the day with bizarre George logic that twists expectations and delights audiences. In other words, everything you love about George is here, just louder and prouder
